net.sf.mmm.client.ui.api.dialog

Interface AbstractDialog

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeReadTitle<String>, AttributeReadVisible
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Dialog, PopupDialog
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractDialogController, AbstractMainDialogController, AbstractNavigationDialogController, AbstractPageDialogController, DialogController, RootDialogController

    public interface AbstractDialog
extends AttributeReadId<String>, AttributeReadTitle<String>, AttributeReadVisible
    This is the abstract base interface for a dialog or screen of the client application. This should NOT be mixed with a popup.
    Since:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Joerg Hohwiller (hohwille at users.sourceforge.net)

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static String PATTERN_DIALOG_ID
      The regex pattern dialog IDs have to match.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      String getId()
      This method gets the ID used to identify this object.
      String getTitle()
      This method gets the title of this object.
      boolean isVisible()
      This method determines if this dialog is currently visible (opened).

    • Field Detail

      • PATTERN_DIALOG_ID

        static final String PATTERN_DIALOG_ID
        The regex pattern dialog IDs have to match.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getTitle

        String getTitle()
        This method gets the title of this object.
        NOTE:
        For generic usage you need to use Object.toString() of the result if NOT null
        Specified by:
        getTitle in interface AttributeReadTitle<String>
        Returns:
        the title or null if not set. The string-representation of the result (if NOT null) needs to be suitable for end-users.

      • getId

        String getId()
        This method gets the ID used to identify this object. An ID should be unique. The ID of a dialog should only contain ASCII letters, Latin digits, hyphens or underscores. It must NOT contain ':', ';', '&', '?', '=', '/', '\\' or ' '.
        Specified by:
        getId in interface AttributeReadId<String>
        Returns:
        the object's ID.
        See Also:
        DialogConstants.DIALOG_ID_ROOT, DialogConstants.DIALOG_ID_PAGE, DialogConstants.DIALOG_ID_HOME

      • isVisible

        boolean isVisible()
        This method determines if this dialog is currently visible (opened).
        Specified by:
        isVisible in interface AttributeReadVisible
        Returns:
        true if visible, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        AttributeReadVisibleRecursive.isVisibleRecursive()
